pageContext.claim: “Don't forget, black lives matter. What was black lives matter? Pigs in a blanket, fry them like bacon. The first time I ever heard of Black Lives Matter, I said, 'That's such a terrible term.' Because it's such a racist term.”
pageContext.analysis: CNN reported those words were chanted at a 2015 protest march held by a group in St. Paul, Minnesota, that was independent of, and not affiliated with, Black Lives Matter -- which is not a singular entity but an informal movement of people calling for racial justice and an end to police brutality and police killings of unarmed African Americans.
